newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: S'pore Tech Tele, S'pore Power in telephone bid.
newsitem.headline: S'pore Tech Tele, S'pore Power in telephone bid.

text.p: Singapore Technologies Telemedia and Singapore Power said on Monday they had entered a partnership to bid for Singapore's second nationwide full service telephone licence.
The companies, both government-linked, said in a joint statement the partnership would bring strong benefits to the local telecommunications industry.

The statement gave no financial details but a spokeswoman for Singapore Technologies Telemedia (STT), a unit of the private Singapore Technologies group, told Reuters the venture could require a substantial investment.
"Industry estimates say it could cost up to Singapore $1 billion to roll out the infrastructure if the bid for the licence were successful," said the spokeswoman, who declined to be identified.
Both Singapore Technologies and Singapore Power are owned by state investment company Temasek Holdings.
The Singapore government said in September it would allow at least one, and possibly two, new operators to compete directly with the current domestic telephone monopoly Singapore Telecom from 2000.
The first stage of the pre-qualification process for the licence would be held on March 1, 1997.
